program_description: RCDI grants help qualified nonprofit housing and community development intermediary organizations support eligible housing, community facilities, and community and economic development projects in rural areas.
who_can_apply_type_1: Public bodies such as state or local governments and their associated authorities, boards, commissions, or councils
eligible_area_description: Any area other than a city or town with a population greater than 50,000, and the area adjacent to such a city or town.
how_funds_used_main: RCDI grants are used to provide capacity-building assistance to improve housing, community facilities, and community and economic development projects in eligible rural areas.
how_funds_used_example_1: Training sub-grantees to conduct homeownership or business entrepreneur education
how_funds_used_example_2_main: Providing technical assistance to sub-grantees on things such as:
how_funds_used_example_2_sub_4: Creating training tools (videos, workbooks, reference guides)
grant_term_matching_fund_requirement: There is a matching fund requirement equal to the amount of the grant award.
grant_term_partnerships_encouraged: Partnerships with other federal, state, local, or nonprofit organizations are encouraged.
how_to_get_started_process: Applications are accepted annually through a Notice of Funding Opportunity (NOFO) published in the Federal Register.
who_can_answer_questions_source: Your local USDA Rural Development office can help.
governing_program_guidelines: 2 CFR 200 and associated RCDI guidelines as published in the annual Federal Register NOFO
note_information_changes_warning: Because information changes, always consult official program instructions or contact your local USDA Rural Development office for help.
note_usda_equal_opportunity_statement: USDA is an equal opportunity provider, employer, and lender.
